decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Notwithstanding Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), the premises shall only be used for the purposes specified in the application documents (a mixed  workspace, assembly, leisure and commercial space (sui generis) operated in accordance with the approved Management Plan) and for no other purposes whatsoever (including any other purposes falling within Use Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that class in any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification).Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the exact nature of the use of the site and other uses, whether within the same use class or permitted by the General Permitted Development Order, are unlikely to be acceptable in planning terms.

Prior to the preperation or cooking of any hot food, a scheme for the extraction and dispersal of all fumes and odours arising from the development (including details of its method of construction, odour control measures, noise levels, its appearance and its finish) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and then implemented in full. The measures which form the approved scheme shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall operate / be managed in accordance with the approved Management Plan May 2021 (includes opening hours)Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012, and to ensure the proper planning of the area.

The development hereby approved shall only be occupied / used / managed in accordance with the approved Flood Risk Assessment.Reason: To prevent the patrons of the development from being exposed to the risks of flooding, in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS1 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
Please provide elevations and other details of bin and cycle storage.

All applications that involve extensions of 2 or more storeys, or where the resultant extension / development is above 2 storeys in height i.e. roof extension must provide "25 Degree" Elevation Plans. These should be drawn at a scale of 1:50 or 1:100, they should accurately identify neighbouring building(s) and window(s) and when possible indicate the use of the room served by the window(s), and should be annotated to show the application of the '25 degree rule'. Please see the Householder Validation Local List for more information.

The Householder Validation Local List requires a completed Biodiversity Checklist for all applications. Please download and complete a copy of the Biodiversity Checklist from: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications
Housholder Checklist Update - Once you have provided any additional documents please update the Householder Checklist document to confirm that they have been provided by stating "Yes" where relevant.

DESCRI

description: Change of use from retail space (Class A1) to workspace, assembly, leisure and commercial space (sui generis ) (no structural work proposed), refurbishment of existing undercroft site to create an arts performance, exhibition and work space with maximum capacity of 200 people and modernisation / internal works to include creation of two store rooms, installation of new unisex toilets and Kitchen.
